metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9902 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Pocket toolbar button, once activated, listens for events fired from it's own pages but does not verify the origin of incoming events. This allows content from other origins to fire events and inject content and commands into the Pocket context. Note: this issue does not affect users with e10s enabled. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 45.6 and Firefox < 50.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
